com.ibm.team.repository.client
Interface ITeamRepositoryService

All Superinterfaces:
IEventSource
public interface ITeamRepositoryService
extends IEventSource

Service for establishing contact with team repositories.

Clients wishing to access objects stored in the repository must work through the server. A URI identifies the team server and provides location information so that a network connection can be opened to the server. Because of their 1-1 correspondence, the terms team server and team repository are often used interchangeably.

The repository service maintains a pool of team repository instances for the same URI. This allows clients to re-use the same instance and connection to the server. If a client wishes to not share team repository instances with other clients they can call ITeamRepositoryService.getUnmanagedRepository(String) and obtain a new instance which is not known or managed by the repository service.

Login handlers can be added to a specific server and will be called whenever credentials for the server are needed, either because none are available or the last login failed. You can also add a login handler to all servers by registering a ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler via the com.ibm.team.repository.client.loginHandler extension point.

A certificate handler will be consulted whenever a repository server presents a problematic SSL certificate. A problematic certificate may be expired, not yet valid, or signed by an untrusted authority. You can add a global certificate handler for all servers by registering an ICertificateHandler via the com.ibm.team.repository.client.certificateHandler extension point. A certificate handler cannot be registered for a specific server because the underlying session and user key stores apply to all connections.

Clients can receive notification about additions and removal of team repositories from the instance pool maintained by the repository service. The com.ibm.team.repository.client.eventListener extension point can be used to register generic listeners with the ITeamRepositoryService event source.

The server registry provides notifications for the following properties:

  • ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepositories()

The repository service is intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Its method can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Since:
0.5

Method Detail

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI,
                                  int flags)
Returns a repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI. The URI must conform to the syntax given in RFC 3986 . Depending of the value specified for flags, this method may return an existing repository instance which has been created earlier by another client. In this case, the caller cannot assume anything about the state of the returned team repository; it could be logged-in or logged-out.

Here are sample server URIs which identify team repositories:

  • http://localhost:8080/jazz/public
  • https://localhost:8080/jazz/secure
A team repository is only accessible via the http protocol hence a valid server URL must starts with http or https (e.g. for SSL access to a repository). Next, the hostname and port is user specified and identifies the address and port of the server which provides access to the repository. The port is optional and if not specified the default port for the protocol will be used. The next segment in the URI is the context which identifies the team repository name installed on the server. This name is can be configured by the server administrator but the default is jazz. The last segment identifies the entry point into the repository either public or secure access.

Clients listening to events from this service will receive notifications about additions of shared team repositories from the instance pool maintained by the repository service, only if a call to addTeamRepository is made.

if (@link #UNSHARED ITeamRepositoryService.UNSHARED} is specified, the returned repository handle will not be managed by the repository service and other clients will not receive notifications about it's existence.

if (@link #MANUAL_LOGIN_HANDLERS ITeamRepositoryService.MANUAL_LOGIN_HANDLERS} is specified, login handlers must be manually registered by calling ITeamRepository.registerLoginHandler(ILoginHandler)

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify ITeamRepositoryService.DEFAULT to get a shared repository (recommended) that uses the default login handler; specify ITeamRepositoryService.UNSHARED to get an unshared repository; specify ITeamRepositoryService.MANUAL_LOGIN_HANDLERS to get a repository that does not use default login handlers; specify ITeamRepositoryService.EXISTING_SHARED to get an already existing shared repository without creating any new instance.
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null if the ITeamRepositoryService.EXISTING_SHARED is not used.

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI)
Returns a repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI.

The method is equivalent to getTeamRepository(repositoryURI, ITeamRepositoryService.DEFAULT).

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, int)

getUnmanagedRepository

ITeamRepository getUnmanagedRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI)
Returns a shared repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI.

The method is equivalent to getTeamRepository(repositoryURI, ITeamRepositoryService.UNSHARED | ITeamRepositoryService.MANUAL_LOGIN_HANDLERS).

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, int)

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a shared repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI.

Calling this method as opposed to calling ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String), has the advantage that this call will iterate over the existing repository handles and tries to find a matching repository handle based on the repository root item identifier. The repository root item identifier can only be available if the repository handle is logged in. Calling this method will avoid returning a new repository handle while another handle that uses a slightly different URI already exists.

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the login was unsuccessful for any reason
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, int)

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI,
                                  int timeoutInSeconds,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a shared repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI and sets the connection timeout for contacting the repository.

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
timeoutInSeconds - the connection timeout in seconds; must be non-negative
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the login was unsuccessful for any reason
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, IProgressMonitor)

getTeamRepositoryWithOverride

ITeamRepository getTeamRepositoryWithOverride(java.lang.String repositoryURI,
                                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a shared repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI.

Calling this method, as opposed to calling any of the getTeamRepository methods, has the advantage that this call will iterate over the existing repository handles and try to find a matching repository handle based on the repository root item identifier. If a root item identifier cannot be retrieved from the given URI then an exception will be thrown. If a match is found then the given URI will replace the existing one as the main URI of the repository and the old URI will become an alias. Calling this method will avoid returning a new repository handle while another handle with the same root identifier already exists, but will always return a new handle if the root identifier does not match any existing.

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the repository cannot be contacted for any reason
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, int)

getApplicationTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getApplicationTeamRepository(java.lang.String repositoryURI,
                                             int timeoutInSeconds,
                                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a shared repository handle on the team repository and server identified by the given URI and sets the connection timeout for contacting the repository. The returned repository is restricted from logging into a JTS server.

Parameters:
repositoryURI - the URI of the server and repository; a URI whose syntax conforms to RFC 3986; must not be null
timeoutInSeconds - the connection timeout in seconds; must be non-negative
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a team repository object, which is never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the login was unsuccessful for any reason
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
See Also:
ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, IProgressMonitor)

addTeamRepository

void addTeamRepository(ITeamRepository repository)
Adds the given repository to the pool of known repository instances. Clients listening to this service will receive notifications about addition of team repositories to the instance pool of known repositories maintained by the repository service.

Parameters:
repository - the repository to add; must be an already shared instance; must not be null

removeTeamRepository

void removeTeamRepository(ITeamRepository repository)
Removes the given repository from maintained pool of known repository instances. Clients listening to this service will receive notifications about removal of team repositories from the instance pool of known repositories maintained by the repository service.

Parameters:
repository - the repository to remove; must be an already shared instance; must not be null

removeRepository

@Deprecated
void removeRepository(ITeamRepository repository)
Deprecated. use ITeamRepositoryService.removeTeamRepository(ITeamRepository) instead

getTeamRepositories

ITeamRepository[] getTeamRepositories()
Returns the list of repositories known to this service or an empty list if none are known.

Returns:
the list of servers, or an empty list if none are known; never null

getDefaultConnectionTimeout

int getDefaultConnectionTimeout()
Returns the time in milliseconds the client will wait for a response from the repository before the connection is cancelled.

Returns:
the time in milliseconds the client will wait for a response from the repository before the connection is cancelled.

addRepositoryServiceListener

void addRepositoryServiceListener(ITeamRepositoryService.IRepositoryServiceListener listener)
Registers a listener to listen to team repository additions and removals. A listener can only be registered once with a given team repository service; subsequent calls to register the same listener will be ignored.

Parameters:
listener - the new listener to be registered; must not be null

removeRepositoryServiceListener

void removeRepositoryServiceListener(ITeamRepositoryService.IRepositoryServiceListener listener)
Deregisters an already registered listener. Deregistering a non-registered listener has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be deregistered; must not be null

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository(UUID repositoryId)
Returns the team repository with the given identifier.

Parameters:
repositoryId - UUID id
Returns:
the team repository with the given id, or null if not found
